pr_title: Add jextract option to disable buildID check

timeline.message:
Add jextract option to disable buildID check

Disable check if '-r' option is present.

* always query environment pointer before analyzing dump
* clean up jextract support code
* describe all options in '-help' output
* generate J9VM_UNIQUE_BUILD_ID randomly for cmake builds

Signed-off-by: Keith W. Campbell <keithc@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: -interactive is no longer useful, it was replaced by DDR. We kept it alive after DDR was available to support the trprint subcommand, but trying to run that, it doesn't seem to work very well any more and I don't think anybody uses it. Bottom line, it shouldn't be included in the help, and I expect we could delete all the associated code.
timeline.author: pshipton

replies.bodyText: Ok, I won't mention -interactive. I created #10764 to track removing the option and the support infrastructure.
replies.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand the purpose of this, perhaps a more detailed message is appropriate.
timeline.author: pshipton

replies.bodyText:
This is a commonly supported option with the meaning that subsequent arguments are not treated as options (even if they begin with -). A (perhaps unlikely) example:
jextract -r -- -v

considers the file named -v to be the core file.
replies.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText: I think it's a GNU convention; see the bash manual, for example.
replies.author: keithc-ca
